dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: SYF Offers Greater Flexibility With Apple Pay's Pay Later Feature
News Content: Synchrony Financial SYF recently made the Pay Later feature of Apple Pay available to eligible Synchrony Preferred Mastercard, Synchrony Plus World Mastercard or Synchrony Premier World Mastercard holders. The specified cardholders now have the flexibility to either utilize their credit card's standard terms or take advantage of a promotional offer featuring fixed monthly payments at checkout.

To utilize a Synchrony Mastercard with Apple Pay, cardholders must first add their card to Apple Wallet. When making purchases online or in app, using Apple Pay on an iPhone or iPad, customers can select their Synchrony Mastercard. If eligible, they can select the Pay Later option to view available promotional offers. They can then choose their preferred option and complete the fast and convenient checkout process with Apple Pay.

Apple Pay offers a secure, private and convenient payment experience for its users. When using a Synchrony Mastercard with Apple Pay, transaction details remain confidential, as Apple does not store any information associated with the user's purchases.

Synchrony plans to extend the option to pay for eligible purchases using fixed monthly payments to a broader range of Apple Pay users within its portfolio of co-branded cards. Later this year, customers will also gain the ability to view and redeem rewards from eligible Synchrony-issued cards while checking out online or in app on iPhone and iPad with Apple Pay.

Therefore, the ulterior motive of Synchrony behind the recent announcement remains to offer a greater level of choice and flexibility to its customers at the time of checkout. The availability of a suitable financing solution that removes the need to make lumpsum payments and does not exert pressure on one’s finances may boost the purchasing power of consumers.

Benefits of the Recent Move to Synchrony

The facility of providing simplified digital transactions and addressing the diversified credit needs of customers is expected to attract newer customers to Synchrony as well as retain existing ones. Increased utilization of Synchrony’s credit cards may bring growth in interest and fees on loans, from which SYF mainly earns its revenues. Interest and fees on loans advanced 10.5% year over year in the first nine months of 2024.

The well-earned reputation of SYF can be attributed to its digital and analytics expertise. A series of acquisitions and partnerships, coupled with tech investments, have strengthened the company’s digital arm. This, in turn, has fetched several program agreements with some of the nation’s leading retailers and manufacturers.

Story Continues

SYF’s Share Price Performance & Zacks Rank

Shares of Synchrony have gained 89.6% in the past year compared with the industry’s 24.5% growth. SYF currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Stocks to Consider

Some better-ranked stocks in the Finance space are Intercorp Financial Services Inc. IFS, Ameriprise Financial, Inc. AMP and Civista Bancshares, Inc. CIVB. While Intercorp Financial Services sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) at present, Ameriprise Financial and Civista Bancshares carries Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) each. You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.

The bottom line of Intercorp Financial Services outpaced estimates in three of the last four quarters and missed the mark once, the average surprise being 36.17%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for IFS’ 2025 earnings suggests an improvement of 48.2% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for revenues suggests growth of 9% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for IFS’ 2025 earnings has moved 0.7% north in the past 60 days.

Ameriprise Financial’s earnings outpaced estimates in three of the trailing four quarters and missed the mark once, the average surprise being 0.99%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for AMP’s 2025 earnings suggests an improvement of 14.6% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for revenues suggests growth of 7.6% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for AMP’s 2025 earnings has moved 0.4% north in the past 30 days.

The bottom line of Civista Bancshares outpaced estimates in three of the last four quarters and missed the mark once, the average surprise being 7.72%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for CIVB’s 2025 earnings suggests an improvement of 8.2% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for revenues suggests growth of 6.4% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for CIVB’s 2025 earnings has moved 1.5% north in the past 30 days.

Shares of Intercorp Financial Services, Ameriprise Financial and Civista Bancshares have gained 28.2%, 45.8% and 21.8%, respectively, in the past year.

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The article outlines a positive outlook for Apple, citing strong demand for services and wearables, as well as potential market share gains in light of challenges faced by competitors like Huawei. The introduction of the iPhone 17 and a steady demand despite some iPhone weakness in China contribute to the bullish sentiment. Evercore's price target of $250 and the expectation for a resilient performance during the upcoming quarter indicate a generally optimistic view among analysts. Given these factors, it seems more likely that Apple’s stock price will rise rather than fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The provided news focuses primarily on IMAX (IMAX) and Netflix (NFLX). While Apple (AAPL) is mentioned as a comparator, it's not directly impacted by the Narnia deal. Therefore, the news has minimal immediate impact on Apple's stock. The reference to AAPL releasing movies theatrically before streaming is a neutral data point in this context. Overall, this news would not have an outsized effect up or down on Apple’s stock price. Because the market typically has fluctuations day to day in any context, it's impossible to say there's a 0% change, but in this case, it's more likely that the price will be relatively stable and within its standard range.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on Nvidia's new AI safety tools and its CEO's absence from Trump's inauguration.  While Nvidia's advancements are positive, the article's relevance to Apple is minimal.  The mention of Apple CEO Tim Cook attending the inauguration is purely contextual and doesn't suggest any direct impact on Apple's stock price.  Therefore, the news is unlikely to significantly affect Apple's stock price, either positively or negatively. Any price movement would likely be due to other market factors unrelated to this news.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights delays in TSMC's Arizona plant due to U.S. regulations and labor shortages, which could impact the supply chain for Apple (AAPL) as TSMC is a key supplier. However, TSMC's CEO reassured investors about the quality of the Arizona facility, and the CHIPS Act funding provides long-term support. The immediate impact on Apple's stock is likely neutral to slightly negative due to potential supply chain concerns, but the long-term outlook remains stable given TSMC's commitment to quality and ongoing investment.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses Synchrony Financial's (SYF) recent announcement to offer Apple Pay's Pay Later feature to its eligible cardholders, providing greater flexibility and choice at checkout. This development is expected to boost purchasing power and attract new customers, potentially leading to increased interest and fees on loans. As SYF's digital expertise and partnerships have strengthened, the company has gained a reputation for providing simplified digital transactions. The news is expected to have a positive impact on SYF's stock performance, as it expands the company's offerings and may lead to increased utilization of its credit cards. However, the impact on Apple's stock price (AAPL) is less direct, as the news primarily concerns Synchrony Financial's partnership with Apple Pay.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news about Apple pausing its AI-generated news alerts due to inaccuracy issues may have a slightly negative impact on the stock price in the short term. However, considering Apple's reputation for addressing concerns and improving its features, the long-term impact is likely to be minimal. The temporary pause of the feature and the company's efforts to improve it may be seen as a responsible move, potentially mitigating significant negative consequences on the stock price. Given the nature of the news, which does not indicate a fundamental flaw in Apple's business model or a significant financial loss, the probabilities of a stock price rise or fall are estimated with a slight bias towards a fall due to the immediate reaction to the news, but still acknowledging the overall stability of Apple's stock.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The pause of the AI-generated news alerts by Apple might cause short-term negative sentiment among users and stakeholders, given these features represent the company's entry into innovative technologies. However, Apple often makes iterative updates based on user feedback, so this issue is likely to be resolved, potentially mitigating long-term negative impacts. Moreover, as Apple's core business consists of hardware and high-margin services, which do not seem directly impacted by this situation, the overall effect on the stock could be minimal. Investors' focus on the long-term growth potential of Apple's product ecosystem might overshadow this temporary setback.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```
{
  "reasoning": "The news article discusses Synchrony Financial's (SYF) recent announcement to offer Apple Pay's Pay Later feature to its eligible cardholders, providing greater flexibility and choice at checkout. This development is expected to boost purchasing power and attract new customers, potentially leading to increased interest and fees on loans. However, the impact on Apple's stock price (AAPL) is less direct, as the news primarily concerns Synchrony Financial's partnership with Apple Pay. Given that the news does not directly relate to Apple's core business or financial performance, it is likely to have a minimal impact on Apple's stock price. The overall trend in the tech industry and market conditions will likely have a more significant influence on Apple's stock price than this specific news about Synchrony Financial's partnership with Apple Pay.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "SYF Offers Greater Flexibility With Apple Pay's Pay Later Feature",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.52,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.48
}
```
